page.title: 02Beverstone Castle.
page.content: Beverstone Castle is privately owned and it is not generally open to the public.It stands in the centre of the village between the church and the A4135.The remains of the moat and the west wing can be seen from the track which runs from the main road to the chourch.Incorporated into the eastern section of the castle is a seventeenth century house which is the home of the owners.The castle was owned by the Berkeley family for almost 500 years.It was completely rebuilt in 1220 and extended in 1360.The castle was besieged twice during the Civil War and was eventually captured by the Parliamentarians.Its military importance declined after this and ever since the castle has been used as a farmhouse.
